meanings.definition: Moving or growing in response to sunlight.
meanings.sent1: The heliotropic flowers turned towards the sun to soak up its rays.
meanings.sent2: The plant's heliotropic leaves followed the path of the sun throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The heliotropic tree seemed to be doing a sun dance, swaying back and forth with the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her heliotropic behavior was like a sunflower, always seeking out the light.
meanings.sent5: The heliotropic nature of the plant was evident as it basked in the sunny spot by the window.

meanings.definition: Attracted to or seeking out sunlight.
meanings.sent1: The heliotropic animals preferred to rest in the sunny patches of the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The heliotropic insects buzzed around the bright flowers in search of nectar.
meanings.sent3: The heliotropic cat stretched out lazily in the warm sunlight streaming through the window.
meanings.sent4: His heliotropic tendencies were like a magnet drawing him towards the sunny beach.
meanings.sent5: The heliotropic behavior of the plant was like a beacon guiding it towards the sunlight.
